Chapter Previous Next

class ghostGLDraw

Provides OpenGL based routines for drawing GHOST nodes. Each primitive has a generic drawing routine based on its geometric description as well as a GHOST wrapper. Generally, you'll want to pass a GHOST object to the corresponding wrapper function, which will handle calling the appropriate OpenGL drawing routine with the necessary parameters.

The GHOST wrapper routines all take two parameters. The first parameter is a pointer to the gstShape object. The second parameter specifies whether you want ghostGLDraw to apply the object's local transform to the OpenGL ModelView matrix stack before drawing the geometry.

From header file: ghostGLDraw.h
